lines.content: * Appal class contains functions to initialise Appal.
* Starts by welcoming user and loading previously saved tasks (if applicable),
* then loops the main program to take in user input until exit flag is set.
* Main class provides the main function to initialise and run Appal.
* Creates an instance of the chatbot Appal then runs it.
* AddDeadlineCommand class adds a Deadline task,
* with the task description and deadline date, to the task list.
* @param inputDetails User's input that has been split into
*                     command type, task description and deadline date parameters
* @param isFromUser Indicates whether instruction to add task is from the user or from pre-saved tasks.
* Checks if task description is added as input by the user.
* @throws EmptyTaskException if task description is not specified.
* Executes the command to add a new Deadline task to the task list.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.
* @param ui Ui instance for Appal to show messages.
* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
* @throws AppalException if task description or deadline date is not specified.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {
* AddEventCommand class adds a Event task,
* with the task description and event duration, to the task list.
* @param inputDetails User's input that has been split into
*                     command type, task description, start and end date parameters
* @param isFromUser Indicates whether instruction to add task is from the user or from pre-saved tasks.
* Checks if task description is added as input by the user.
* @throws EmptyTaskException if task description is not specified.
* Executes the command to add a new Event task to the task list.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.
* @param ui Ui instance for Appal to show messages.
* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
* @throws AppalException if task description or event duration is not specified.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {
* AddToDoCommand class adds a ToDo task,

* Executes the command to add a new ToDo task to the task list.

* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
* @throws AppalException if task description is not specified.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {
* ByeCommand class executes the procedures to exit the Appal application.

* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
* @throws AppalException if error occurs while saving tasks.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {
* CheckDeadlinesCommand checks the task list for deadlines that are due before or on a user specified date.
* @param specifiedDeadline Specified date by user to check for deadlines.
* @throws InvalidDeadlineFormatException if the user inputs an invalid date format.
* Returns true if a task is a deadline that is due before or on the specified date.
* @return True if is task is a deadline that is due before or on the specified date, false otherwise.
* Executes the command to list out the deadlines that are due before or on the specified date.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.
* @param ui Ui instance for Appal to show messages.
* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {
* Command class represents a generic command, with the abstract method execute()
* that more specific command subclasses will implement.
* @param commandType String that indicates the type of command that is run.
* Returns the exit status of Appal.
* Sets the exit status of Appal.
* Saves tasks from current task list to a text file.
* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task storage.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.
* @throws SaveTasksErrorException if error occurs while saving tasks.
public void saveTasks(Storage storage, TaskList taskList) throws SaveTasksErrorException {
* Executes the command. Implementation will be done in subclasses.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.
* @param ui Ui instance for Appal to show messages.
* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
* @throws AppalException if error occurs while command is being executed.
public abstract void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException;
* DeleteCommand class deletes a specified task from the task list.
* @param inputDetails User's input that has been split into
*                     command type and index of task to be deleted parameters
* Executes the command to delete a task, with a specified index, from the task list.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.

* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
* @throws AppalException if an invalid task index is inputted by the user.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {
* FindCommand class finds tasks that contains the string the user has inputted.
* @param searchTarget The string used to find for tasks that contains it.
* Returns true if and only if the task description contains the specified search target string.
* @param task The task to check its description for the search target.
* @return True if the task description contains the search target, false otherwise.
* Executes the command to find tasks that contain a specified search target string from the task list.
* @param taskList Current task list tracked by Appal.
* @param ui Ui instance for Appal to show messages.
* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.

* @param storage Storage instance for Appal to handle task loading and storage.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @throws AppalException if an invalid index is inputted by the user.
public void execute(TaskList taskList, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws AppalException {

* AppalException handles the default error of invalid input that happen when Appal is running,
* and shows a message to notify user.

* Class constructor, with default invalid input message.

* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String EMPTY_TASK_MESSAGE = "Please specify a task, pal!" +
* InvalidDeadlineException handles the error when user did not input the right format for the deadline date,
* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String INVALID_DEADLINE_FORMAT_MESSAGE = "Oh no...I can't parse your deadline input :(" +
"\nCheck that the date is in the form yyyy-mm-dd!";
* InvalidDeadlineException handles the error when user did not input the search target string,
* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String INVALID_SEARCH_TARGET_MESSAGE = "Please input a valid search target!" +
* InvalidTaskException handles the error when user inputs an invalid index for tasks in the task list,
* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String INVALID_TASK_INDEX_MESSAGE = "Please input a valid task number, pal!" +
"\nType 'list' to see your tasks and each task's corresponding number!";
* NoSavedTasksException notifies user that there are no previously saved tasks to load into
public static final String NO_SAVED_TASKS_MESSAGE = "Seems like there are no saved tasks to load!" +
"\nWe can start by adding the tasks that you wanna track!";
* SaveTasksErrorException handles the error that occurs when saving current tasks into a text file,
* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String SAVE_TASKS_ERROR_MESSAGE = "Oh no...Something went wrong while saving your tasks :(";
* UnspecifiedDeadlineException handles the error when user did not input the Deadline task's deadline date,
* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String UNSPECIFIED_DEADLINE_MESSAGE = "Remember to specify a deadline, pal!" +
* UnspecifiedEventDurationException handles the error when the user did not specify the event duration,
* and shows a message to notify user.
public static final String UNSPECIFIED_EVENT_DURATION_MESSAGE = "Remember to specify a start and end time, pal!" +
